info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 22 at 4:49PM EDT until April 22 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Berks County in eastern Pennsylvania... Lehigh County in eastern Pennsylvania... Carbon County in northeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 530 PM EDT. * At 448 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Snyders to near Birdsboro, moving north at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Lehighton, Palmerton, Kutztown, Jim Thorpe, Slatington, Fleetwood, Nesquehoning, Weatherly, Walnutport, Topton, Bally, Bechtelsville, Lyons, New Mahoning, Neffs, Coffeetown, New Tripoli, Ancient Oaks, Emerald and Claussville. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 55 and 97. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 38 and 55. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 277 and 284. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
